Controls

A sorting and search bar for use to parse a list

Component Description

Controls is a React component that allows parsing of a list via a text search and a sort selector.

Import

import Controls from './Controls';

Props

NameTypeDefaultDescription
darkMode`truefalse`true
sortWithString'byDate'Sorting method
setSortWithFunctionuseState FunctionSorting method edit
searchTermString''Search term str
setSearchTermFunctionuseState FunctionSearch term edit

Usage

<Controls 
  darkMode={Boolean}
  sortWith={String}
  setSortWith={Function}
  searchTerm={String}
  setSearchTerm={Function}
/>

Demo

/*See demo above*/}
{/*Code example below is working React for a use case of Controls*/}
{() => {
  const [data, setData] = React.useState([
    {
      key: 'one',
      name: 'Netflicks',
      amount: '14.99',
      timePeriod: 'month',
      date: {
        day: 23,
        month: 2,
        year: 2020,
      },
      notes: 'these are some notes',
    },
    {
      key: 'two',
      name: 'Wholoo',
      amount: '24.99',
      timePeriod: 'week',
      date: {
        day: 12,
        month: 5,
        year: 2019,
      },
      notes: 'these are some notes also about wholoo',
    },
    {
      key: 'three',
      name: 'Rent',
      amount: '750.00',
      timePeriod: 'month',
      date: {
        day: 1,
        month: 7,
        year: 2018,
      },
      notes: 'these are some notes also about rent',
    },
    {
      key: 'three',
      name: 'Rent',
      amount: '750.00',
      timePeriod: 'month',
      date: {
        day: 1,
        month: 7,
        year: 2018,
      },
      notes: 'these are some notes also about rent',
    },
  ])
  const [user, setUser] = React.useState(null)
  const [darkMode, setDarkMode] = React.useState(true)
  const [sortWith, setSortWith] = React.useState('byDate')
  const [searchTerm, setSearchTerm] = React.useState('')
  const [controlTimePeriod, setControlTimePeriod] = React.useState('default')
  const getFilteredData = () => {
    const tempData = [...data].sort(getCompareFunction(sortWith))
    if (searchTerm) {
      return tempData.filter(
        datum =>
          datum.name.toLowerCase().indexOf(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) > -1 ||
          datum.notes.toLowerCase().indexOf(searchTerm.toLowerCase()) > -1,
      )
    }
    return tempData
  }
  return (
    <>
      <Controls
        darkMode={darkMode}
        sortWith={sortWith}
        setSortWith={setSortWith}
        searchTerm={searchTerm}
        setSearchTerm={setSearchTerm}
      />
      <SubscriptionList
        user={user}
        searchTerm={searchTerm}
        data={getFilteredData()}
        editSubscription={() => {}}
        deleteSubscription={() => {}}
        controlTimePeriod={controlTimePeriod}
      />
    </>
  )
}
